intro: Stigmatopteris hemiptera, commonly known as the narrow-leafed holly fern, is a species of fern characterized by its delicate, feather-like fronds. It belongs to the family Dryopteridaceae and is native to parts of Asia, including China and Japan. The plant features compound leaves with a serrated margin and a distinctive, narrow shape. Its spores are produced on the underside of the fronds in clusters known as sori. Stigmatopteris hemiptera thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
